In this chapter you have learned:
  • The hierarchical design model improves upon the limitation of flat, partial mesh, and mesh design models by improving the performance, scalability, availability, manageability, and maintainability of the network.
  • Hierarchical network topologies facilitate network convergence by providing the performance necessary for voice and video data to be combined onto the existing data network.
  • Traffic flow, user communities, data stores and server location, and topology diagram analysis can be performed to help identify network bottlenecks.
  • The bottlenecks can then be addressed to improve the performance of the network and accurately determine appropriate hardware requirements to satisfy the desired performance of the network.
  • Cisco switches combine specific form factors, performance, PoE, and Layer 3 support that support the levels of the hierarchical network design.
